channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Molecular competition induced Janus hydrogel bioelectronic interface for electroceutical modulation
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 07 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67143-3

Janus hydrogel bioelectronic interfaces are challenged by complex fabrication, poor tunability of asymmetric properties and weak interlayer bonding strength. Here, the authors create a Janus hydrogel with dual structural and compositional gradients in one step via molecular competition induction mechanism.
item.dc:title: Molecular competition induced Janus hydrogel bioelectronic interface for electroceutical modulation
item.dc:creator: Xinyu Qu
Qian Wang
Hanjun Sun
Dingli Gan

Xiaochen Dong
